title: Liability and Damages Principles
content:
Types of Liability:

1. Contractual Liability:
- Breach of contract
- Failure to perform obligations
- Warranties and representations
- Express vs. implied warranties

2. Tort Liability:
- Negligence (duty, breach, causation, damages)
- Intentional torts (battery, defamation, fraud)
- Strict liability (product liability, hazardous activities)

3. Statutory Liability:
- Regulatory violations
- Compliance failures
- Criminal liability

Damage Types:
- Compensatory damages (direct losses)
- Consequential damages (indirect losses)
- Punitive damages (punishment/deterrence)
- Liquidated damages (pre-agreed amounts)
- Nominal damages (technical breach)

Limitation Strategies:
- Liability caps (dollar limits)
- Exclusion clauses (specific exclusions)
- Indemnification provisions (risk transfer)
- Insurance requirements
- Force majeure clauses

Factors Affecting Liability:
- Foreseeability of damages
- Proximate cause
- Contributory/comparative negligence
- Assumption of risk
- Statutory limitations
